name: swift-development
description: Swift language server, autocompletion, building, build errors, linting, Swift formating, Swift Cursor, Swift VSCode

walkthroughs.title: Swift Development for VSCode
walkthroughs.description: Step by step instructions for setting up Swift development in VSCode

steps.title: Install Necessary Tools
steps.description:
To get your Swift development environment setup with [SweetPad](https://github.com/sweetpad-dev/sweetpad), you need install swift-format, xcodegen, swiftlint, xcbeautify, xcode-build-server, ios-deploy and tuist
Click the button below to install all automatically
[Run Shell Script](command:swift-development.installTools)

steps.title: Enable Autocompletion Hints
steps.description:
To generate autocompletions, you need to have a `buildServer.json` file that details your project configuration for SourceKit-LSP: 
[Generate Build Server Config](command:sweetpad.build.genereateBuildServerConfig)

steps.title: Automatically Build on Save
steps.description:
To automatically build the selected target when saving, we must add a `triggerTaskOnSave` task in our `settings.json`:
[Configure `settings.json`](command:swift-development.generateSettings)

steps.title: Add Swift format settings
steps.description:
To automatically format Swift code on save, we must add a `.swift-format` configuration detailing our formatting rules to our `.vscode` folder:
[Add `.swift-format`](command:swift-development.generateFormatterConfig)

steps.title: Add Launch Configuration
steps.description:
Add debug configurations to the VSCode launch.json:
[Configure `launch.json`](command:swift-development.generateLaunch)

steps.title: Build and Run
steps.description:
Test the installation by building and running your project:
[Build and Run](command:swift-development.runSweetpadLaunch)

media.markdown: Open a new terminal using `Ctrl+`\` on macOS or `Ctrl+Shift+\` on Windows/Linux.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
